title: Latin America & Caribbean
text:
The second most powerful hurricane ever recorded has come to a halt over the Bahamas

As Hurricane Dorian continues to inflict damage across the Bahamas chain of Caribbean islands, a local building contractor is doing what he can to rescue people. DeSean Smith is on Grand Bahama where his own house has been flooded and he is taking shelter with his family at his in-laws. But when he heard there were other people still stranded, he went back out into the storm on his jet-ski to try to help. (Picture: Flooding in a residential street on Grand Bahama; Credit: Rob Oluwa)
